title: Off-by-one error in waiting list comparison
description: The compareTo method compares the size of two ExaminationRoom objects. However, it does not account for null elements, which can cause an off-by-one error.

title: Potential null pointer risk in equals method
description: The equals method checks if two ExaminationRoom objects have the same waiting patients. However, it does not check for null waiting patients, which can cause a null pointer exception.

title: Inefficient data structure for waiting lists
description: The Hospital class uses a List to store ExaminationRoom objects. However, this can cause inefficient performance when updating the waiting lists.

title: Potential null pointer risk in constructor
description: One of the constructors for the Doctor class does not check if the specialty is null before assigning it to an instance variable.

title: Potential off-by-one error in age calculation
description: The age method calculates the age of a Patient by subtracting the birth year from the current year. However, it does not account for leap years.

title: Potential security risk in GUI design
description: The UI class uses a Combobox to display patients, but it does not validate the input data. This can cause a security risk if malicious data is entered.

title: Minor code smell in createAddPatientTab method
description: The createAddPatientTab method creates a GridPane with multiple Label objects, but it does not use any layout managers. This can cause inconsistent spacing between elements.

title: Minor code smell in createCheckOutPatientTab method
description: The createCheckOutPatientTab method creates a GridPane with multiple Label objects, but it does not use any layout managers. This can cause inconsistent spacing between elements.
